abstract: The Swiss bank, which has large investment banking operations in New York, will also pay about $2.6 billion in penalties and hire an independent monitor for up to two years.

lead_paragraph: Updated, 10:12 p.m. | Credit Suisse has done what no other bank of its size and significance has done in over two decades: plead guilty to criminal wrongdoing.
